Name: Westminster Abbey Museum
Summary: Royal and other funeral effigies, religious artefacts

Name: Westminster Dragoons Museum
Summary:
Regimental artefacts, regalia and memorabilia, collection currently in 
storage[23]

Name: White Lodge Museum and Ballet Resource Centre
Summary:
History of the Royal Ballet School, daily life of its students, history and 
development of Classical ballet, history of White Lodge, visits by 
appointment

Name: Whitechapel Gallery
Summary: Contemporary art

Name: Whitehall
Summary: Tudor house with elements from different eras

Name: Whitewebbs Museum of Transport
Summary: Cars, trucks, motorcycles, model railway[24]

Name: Wiener Library
Summary:
Exhibits of art and history from its collections about the Holocaust and 
genocides around the world

Name: William Morris Gallery
Summary: Arts and Crafts movement furniture, textiles, ceramics and glass

Name: Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Museum
Summary: History of tennis

Name: Wimbledon Windmill Museum
Summary: 19th century windmill, exhibits on its history and other windmills

Name: World Rugby Museum
Summary:
Rugby union history and the England national rugby union team, players, 
memorabilia, history of Twickenham Stadium
